ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Have you ever had a period of at least one week when you were bothered most of the day, nearly every day, by feeling depressed, sad, down, low?
By feeling irritable?
By feeling anxious?
Have you ever had a period of at least one week when you did not enjoy most things, even things you usually like to do?
INTERVIEWER: Do you suspect a past or current episode from subject's responses, behavior, or other information?
If yes: Specify subject's responses, behavior, or other information:
Have you been feeling that way recently (i.e., for at least one week during the past days)?
If yes: How long have you felt this way?
Think about the most severe period in your life when you were feeling this way. When did it begin?
INTERVIEWER: Compute age of most severe period
How long did the period last? (weeks)
Did you feel depressed, sad, down, or low?
Did you feel irritable?
Did you feel anxious?
INTERVIEWER: Is the most severe episode also the current episode?
Did you have a loss of appetite or did your appetite greatly increase?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes, decreased; 2= Yes, increased; 3= Yes, mixture; 9= Unknown/No information

ElementDescription: Did you lose/gain weight when you were not trying to?
What was your weight before the loss/gain?
What was your weight after the loss/gain?
Over what period of time did you lose/gain this amount of weight?
Did you have trouble sleeping or were you sleeping more than usual?
Were you unable to fall asleep?
Was this for at least one hour?
Were you waking up in the middle of the night and having trouble going back to sleep?
Were you waking up too early in the morning?
Was this at least one hour earlier than usual?
Were you sleeping much more than usual?
Were you so fidgety or restless that other people could have notices (eg., pacing or writing hands)?
Were you moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed?
Were you much less able to enjoy sex and other pleasurable activities?
Did you lose interest in nearly all of your usual activities?
Were you feeling a loss of energy or more tired than usual?
Were you feeling guilty or that you were a bad person?
Were you feeling that you were a failure or worthless?
Were you having difficulty thinking, concentrating, or making decisions?
Were you frequently thinking about death, or wishing you were dead, or thinking about taking your life?
Did you actually try to harm yourself?
INTERVIEWER: Enter number of boxes with at least one YES response in questions
During this episode was there a two-week period when these symptoms were present nearly every day (at least four symptoms plus depressed mood)?
Did you tend to feel worse in the morning or in the evening or was there no difference?
During this episode, did you have beliefs or ideas that you later found out were not true?
INTERVIEWER: If delusions are suspected, probe further to determine the content and whether the beliefs were held with certainty. Code on the basis of this information and describe below:
Were you convinced of these beliefs at the time?
Did these beliefs occur either just before this depression or after it cleared?
How long were they present before the depression began?
How long did they last after your mood returned to normal?
INTERVIEWER: Does this total more than 14 days?
Did you see or hear things that other people could not see or hear?
If yes to hearing voices: Specify:
Were you using any street drugs at the times that you experienced these?
If yes to using street drugs: What were they?
Notes: (INTERVIEWER: List the drugs used and describe the frequency of use and doses, if possible.)

ElementDescription: If voices: Did these voices usually seem to originate: from within your head?
If voices: Did these voices usually seem to originate: from outside your head?
If voices: Did these voices usually seem to originate: from some particular place outside your head?
If voices: Did these voices usually seem to originate: Were these voices definitely different from your own thoughts?
Did these (refer to experiences) occur either just before this depression or after it cleared?
How long were they present before the depression began?
How long did they last after your mood returned to normal?
INTERVIEWER: Does this total more than 14 days?
INTERVIEWER: Did psychotic symptoms have content that was inconsistent with depressive themes such as poverty, guilt, illness, personal inadequacy or catastrophe?
INTERVIEWER: Was the subject preoccupied with psychotic symptoms to the exclusion of other symptoms or concerns?
Did you seek or receive help from a doctor or other professional for this period of depression?
Were you prescribed medication for depression or was there a change in your dosage?
If yes prescribed medication for depression: Specify:
During this episode were you admitted to the hospital for depression (including day hospital)?
If yes to admitted to the hospital for depression: For how long (inpatient)?
If yes to  admitted to the hospital for depression: For how long (day hospital) ?
Did you receive ECT (shock treatments)?
Was your major responsibility during this episode job, home, school, or something else?
If other responsibilities: Specify:
Was your functioning in this role affected?
If yes: Specify how your role was affected:
Did something happen as a result of this (such as marital separation, absence from work or school, loss of a job, or lower grades)?
If yes: Specify results episode:
Did someone notice a change in your functioning?
INTERVIEWER: If impaired or incapacitated: Specify:
Was your functioning in any other area of your life affected?
If yes functioning in other areas affecting life: Specify:
Is there any other evidence of clinically significant distress?
If yes to evidence of clinically significant distress: Specify:
Did this episode occur during pregnancy or just after childbirth?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes, pregnancy; 2= Yes, after childbirth; 9= Unknown

ElementDescription: What was the date of childbirth?
Did this episode occur during or shortly after a serious physical illness?
If yes: Specify physical illness:
Did this episode begin shortly after you started taking any prescribed medication?
If yes: Specify prescribed medication:
Did this episode begin while you were using street drugs?
If yes: Specify street drugs:
Did this episode follow increased use of alcohol?
If yes: Specify alcohol use:
Did this episode follow decreased use of alcohol?
If yes: Specify alcohol use:
Did this episode follow the death of someone close to you?
If yes: Specify relationship:
Date of death
During this episode of depression did you have a week or more during which your mood frequently changed between sadness and irritability or even elation?
During this episode of depression did you also experience: Overactivity; Running around, many projects, or physically agitated?
During this episode of depression did you also experience: More talkative than usual, speech pressured?
During this episode of depression did you also experience: Thoughts racing, jumping from topic to topic?
During this episode of depression did you also experience: Feeling grandiose; more important, special, powerful?
During this episode of depression did you also experience: Needing less sleep; energetic after little or no sleep?
During this episode of depression did you also experience: Attention distracted by unimportant things?
During this episode of depression did you also experience: Doing risky things for pleasure; spending, sex, reckless driving, etc.?
INTERVIEWER: Enter number of YES responses
How long were these symptoms present? Days
How long were these symptoms present? Weeks
Did you have at least one other episode when you were depressed for at least one week and had several of the symptoms you described?
When was the most recent time that you had depression that was almost as severe as the time we just talked about?
Is the selected episode also the current episode (in the past days)?
When did episode begin?
INTERVIEWER: Compute age when episode happened
How long (did that period last/has it lasted)?
Did you feel depression, sad, down or low?
Did you feel irritable?
Did you feel anxious?
Did you have a loss of appetite or did your appetite greatly increase?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes, decreased; 2= Yes, increased; 3= Yes, mixture; 9= Unknown/No information
